intro: Adenogyne mucronata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved adenogyne, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Adenogyne mucronata is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and blooms.
